About This Game

The Legend Of King Arthur Reborn!

A vast army has gathered in front of the castle gates and is preparing to attack King Arthur! How has it come to this?
Witness important events in the history of the legendary king and accompany him and his army on the path to an uncertain future. It is up to you to restore the honor, the glory and the reign of the Arthurian line, and rewrite the course of history!
Good or evil? The decision is entirely yours! Two extensive campaigns give you insight into both sides of the war.

Key Features

  • Construct impregnable fortresses, equip them with units, ditches and palisades and crush the hordes of enemies with your defense structures!
  • A fortress alone does not mean victory! Build a dependable infrastructure and manage your resources.
  • Your strategy will decide between victory and defeat! Only with the right combination of defense structures, units, extraction of raw materials, and production, will you emerge victorious from the sieges.
  • Experience epic battles with realistic destruction! Assemble your army from a multitude of different units. But beware of falling rubble and take geographical conditions into account in your battle plan.
  • Unlock legendary characters! Complete specific tasks and gain the support of famous heroes, granting you strategic advantages in battle.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP (SP2) / Vista / 7 / 8
    • Processor: 2.5 GHz dual core
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: 1GB Graphics Memory with Shader 3.0
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 8 GB available space
    • Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible
    • Additional Notes: Supported Graphics Cards: NVIDIA GeForce 7900 / 8 / 9 / GT / GTS / GTX series; ATI Radeon X1900 / HD 2000 / HD 3000 / HD 4000 / HD 5000 series
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows XP (SP2) / Vista / 7 / 8
    • Processor: 3.5 GHz dual core or better
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: 1GB Graphics Memory with Shader 3.0 or better (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 or better, AMD Radeon HD 7700 or better)
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 8 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: Supported Graphics Cards: NVIDIA GeForce 7900 / 8 / 9 / GT / GTS / GTX series; ATI Radeon X1900 / HD 2000 / HD 3000 / HD 4000 / HD 5000 series
READ MORE

62 of 69 people (90%) found this review helpful

jkacala127
89 products in account
21 reviews
Not Recommended
9.3 hrs on record
Posted: June 16
GREAT CONCEPT! There is a lot of vairty in just one class of soilder, in most games of this nature you might just have crossbow men and archers, you have other type of bow type of soilders so you have to vairty of soilders.

Besides that, the game falls flat and is simply broken. Yes the dreaded broken game my friends. I played and played level 3 a several times, and can't beat it because the game doesn't want me to, it's not due to lack of trying or being defeated....It just freezes on the level after a half hour or so.

In any game, buidling your castle is one of the most fun parts, it's a freak'en nightmare. Nothing lines up, even when you think your walls are together they aren't, for some odd reason. When you finally do get your castle walls straight it seems like you only need a handful of bowmen to fend off any baddies.

The AI took the short bus to school, they charge your castle in small groups sort of like they are hazing you and testing you out but they end up accomplishing nothing.

It does have an interesting system when it comes to getting resources, you just don't chop down word, you have to make them into planks with a special production house. I like the mirco mangement, and you can switch workers from job to job. I like RTS games where it takes time to raise an army and it's not just about who can build the fastest army first like starcraft.

I would have finished the game dispite it's flaws but at the end of the day when a game is broken and can't play you can't give it a thumbs up.

Not Recommended

Posted: June 15
this game is terrible.
Luckily I had no problems with crashing through nearly the entire first level (although I did crash near the end).

Outside of that, however, the design on this game was just COMPLETE trash. I had no damn clue what I was supposed to be doing the entire time, how do I gather resources? what the hell are my peons doing?

What? I'm under attack? Where?
Make a wall? What? how?
Oh, I can't make a wall anywhere but here.
oh they just go around the wall..

Even MAKING the castle in the screenshots, without enemies and with unlimited resources, is impossible. the UI is just SO broken.

Save the money you would spend on this game and buy the equivalent amount of salt.
Now poor the salt in a bath then turn on the taps.
The salt will last a lot longer then you would do playing (I say "playing" in a very loose sence as you cannot actually play it!) the useless game. And the benefit of doing this will be to clean out the waste pipe from your bath. So a double bonus.
